courseDetails.title: Microsoft Excel Eğitimi | Başlangıçtan İleri Seviyeye
courseDetails.shortDescription: İleri Seviye Excel Kullanıcısı Olmak İçin A'dan Z'ye Her Şeyi (Tablolar, Grafikler, Formüller, Tasarımlar...) Öğrenelim!
courseDetails.longDescription:
Merhaba arkadaşlar,


Bu alanda sizlere Microsoft Excel kullanmanın avantajlarından bahsetmeyeceğim, şu an bu veya benzeri kursları inceliyorsanız böyle bir bilgilendirmeye ihtiyacınızın olduğunu düşünmüyorum ancak bu eğitimin içeriğine ve eğitimden maksimum fayda sağlayabilmek için uygulayabileceğiniz birkaç küçük bilgiye değinmek istiyorum.


Excel eğitim kursumuz, kurs içeriğinden de anlaşılacağı üzere teorik ve pratik kabiliyet kazandırıp öğrenme sürecinin pekiştirilebilmesi açısından tıpkı lise, üniversite ders müfredatlarında olduğu gibi belirli bir disiplin ve metodik sıralı hiyerarşiye bağlı kalarak hazırlanmıştır. Yani emeklemeden koşturmaya yönelik gereksiz ve zorlayıcı bir sürecin içinde olmayacaksınız.


Bununla birlikte kursumuz 28 saat uzunluğunda olup içinde 22 bölüm, 217 ders, 180 formül, +1.000 benzersiz bilgi, +1.000 örnek/genel tekrar, başlangıç ve bitiş aşamasında olmak üzere 2 adet Seviye Tespit Sınavı, 70 adet egzersiz dosyası barındırmaktadır.


Yine hem kurs isminden hem de içindekiler öğelerinden de anlaşılacağı üzere eğitim kursumuz, temelden yani başlangıçtan ileri seviyeye olmak üzere her seviyeye hitap edebilecek şekilde mümkün olduğunca basit ancak detaylı, aceleden uzak tane tane anlatım metodu benimsenerek hazırlanmıştır. Bu açıdan eğer iyi bildiğinizi düşündüğünüz bir ders veya konu varsa ilgili dersi pas geçmek de bir tercih olsa da bu yolu tercih etmenizi tavsiye etmiyorum. Her ne kadar derslerin açıklama kısmında ilgili derslerin içerikleri paylaşılmış olsa da dersin işlenme aşamasında farklı konu ve noktalara değinilmiş olabilir. Öte yandan hem bu tercih yerine (yani dersi izlemeden pas geçmek) hem de hem de video akışını kendi anlama ve öğrenme alışkanlığınıza uygun olarak kalibre edebilmek adına ders videolarının hızını arttırmayı ya da azaltmayı birinci seçenek olarak değerlendirmeniz yararınıza olacaktır.


Öğrenme sürecinize pozitif etki edebilecek bazı tavsiyeler de vermek istiyorum.


  • Konsantre olun. Ders videolarını izlerken konsantrasyonunuzu olumsuz etkileyecek faktörleri minimize etmelisiniz.

  • Not alın. Zorlandığınız veya karıştırdığınız noktalarda basit ve adım adım notlar almanız yazım esnasında da size tekrar etme imkanı vereceğinden etkili olacaktır.

  • Pratik yapın. Ders videolarının önemli bir kısmında pratik yapabilmeniz için ilgili derse ait egzersiz dosyaları bulunmaktadır. Hem bu dosyalar üzerinden hem de farklı kaynaklardan bulacağınız örneklerle bol bol pratik yapmanız öğrenme sürecinizin kısalmasına büyük katkı verecektir.

  • Farklı kaynaklardan da yararlanın. Yalnızca bu ders içeriğinde alacağınız bilgilerle yetinmeyin, farklı kaynaklar üzerinden de araştırma yapmanız, video izlemeniz hem tekrar etme ve pratik yapma imkanı sunacak hem de bilgi dağarcığınızı zenginleştirecektir.

  • Ders videolarının hızını arttırın. Ders videolarını izledikten sonra hızı arttırarak tekrar izlemek dersin pekiştirilmesi açısından önemli katkı verecektir.

  • Disiplinli olun. Bu aşamada size verebileceğim en önemli tavsiyem azimli ve disiplinli olmanızdır. Kendinize göre periyodik bir planlama yaparak düzenli bir biçimde dersleri izlemeniz, araştırmanız, azami derecede pratik yapmanız son derece önemlidir. Zira herhangi bir kaynaktan alacağınız bilgi hap niteliğinde değildir, takviyedir. Bu takviye ancak azim ve disiplin ile birleştiği takdirde öğrenme hızınızı ve becerinizi maksimize edecektir.


Excel kullanım kabiliyetinizin ileri seviye olarak değerlendirilmesi konusunda dünya genelinde kabul görmüş standartlar bulunmamaktadır. Bununla birlikte ileri seviye Excel kullanıcısı olmak için aslında öne çıkan iki parametre vardır; hız ve bilgi. Bu açıdan öncelikli hedefimiz bilgi birikimimizi arttırmak sonrasında ise bol pratik ile hızlanmak olmalıdır. İleri seviye Excel kullanıcısı olabilmeniz için bilginizi ve hızınızı arttıracak tüm girdileri bu eğitim kursumuzda bulabileceksiniz.


Öte yandan başlangıç ve bitiş sınavları ile birlikte kat ettiğiniz mesafeyi eğitimin sonunda kendiniz de görebileceksiniz.


Umarım keyifli ve faydalı bir eğitim süreci olur, sağlıcakla:)
targetAudiences: Microsoft Excel kullanımını öğrenmek ya da mevcut deneyimini/seviyesini ilerletmek isteyen herkes katılım gösterebilir.

courseDetails.title: Rust Programming Bootcamp
courseDetails.shortDescription: 100 Days of Rust Development: Build a Project Every Day
courseDetails.longDescription:
100 Days of Rust Development: Build a Project Every Day is an immersive, hands-on programming course designed to take you from a Rust novice to an advanced developer through practical experience and daily coding challenges. With a focus on building one project each day, this course ensures that learners not only understand Rust's syntax and core concepts but also gain real-world skills by applying them in diverse projects.

The course is structured into five progressive phases:

  1. Rust Fundamentals (Days 1–20) – Build a strong foundation by working on beginner-friendly projects such as calculators, guessing games, and word counters. You'll learn essential Rust concepts, including ownership, borrowing, and control flow.

  2. Intermediate Rust (Days 21–40) – Deepen your knowledge by exploring error handling, generics, and concurrency. Projects in this phase include chat applications, multi-threaded tools, and custom sorting algorithms.

  3. Systems Programming (Days 41–60) – Gain exposure to low-level programming tasks such as file handling, encryption tools, and TCP/HTTP servers. These projects prepare you for building performant and secure backend systems.

  4. Web Development with Rust (Days 61–80) – Learn to build backend services with Actix-Web and create frontend interfaces with Yew. You'll also work on APIs, authentication systems, and database integration.

  5. Full-Stack Rust Projects (Days 81–100) – Combine backend and frontend expertise to build production-ready full-stack applications, including a final capstone project such as a social media platform or a real-time dashboard.

This course balances theory with practice, offering a hands-on experience that ensures you're consistently learning and applying new concepts. By the end of the 100 days, you'll have developed 100 projects, each reinforcing a specific Rust concept or skill. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced programmer, this course adapts to your pace, focusing on gradual improvement and consistent practice.

Join us on this exciting journey and master Rust—the language known for its performance, safety, and modern syntax. Build projects, gain confidence, and become a proficient Rust developer!
targetAudiences: Beginners Curious About Rust: Ideal for those with little to no experience in Rust but eager to learn a powerful systems programming language.
Intermediate Developers: Great for programmers familiar with other languages looking to master Rust’s unique concepts and capabilities.
Aspiring Backend and Systems Engineers: Perfect for those interested in building efficient, safe, and scalable backend services or systems tools
Developers Seeking Hands-On Practice: Designed for learners who prefer a project-based approach to solidify their Rust skills through daily coding challenges

courseDetails.title: Real Ethical Hacking in 43 Hours: Certificated CSEH+CEH PRO
courseDetails.shortDescription: Ethical Hacking, Pentest, Python Hacking, CEH, Metasploit, Linux , Nmap, Linux Hacking, OSCP and other awesome topics. +
courseDetails.longDescription:
Ethical hacking is the identification and exploitation of security vulnerabilities for the purpose of improving an organization’s cyber security. Ethical hacking helps organizations improve their security status by uncovering exposures that are beneath the surface and providing support to address them.

An ethical hacker, also commonly referred to as a white hat hacker, is a cyber security professional entrusted to perform ethical hacking assessments. Certified ethical hackers possess a comprehensive understanding of the tactics and techniques that malicious ‘black hat’ attackers use and leverage this knowledge to ensure that ethical hacking assessments accurately reflect real-life adversarial approaches.

The term ethical hacking is used to describe a broad range of assessment types. From penetration tests performed over a matter of days, to red team operations conducted over weeks and months, ethical hacking engagements vary significantly in scope, duration and price.

Although ethical hacking is sometimes used interchangeably with penetration testing, there are some important differences.

Ethical hackers may get involved in tactics beyond penetration testing. For example, they might choose to test defenses against social engineering techniques by encouraging employees to reveal sensitive business data or log-in credentials.

On the other hand, penetration testing is focused solely on assessing one or a few network vulnerabilities that organizations may have.

Ethical hackers can be independent freelance consultants, employed by a firm that specializes in simulated offensive cybersecurity services, or they can be an in-house employee protecting a company’s website or apps. Knowledge of current attack methods and tools is a requirement across these employment options, however, the in-house ethical hacker may be required to have an intimate knowledge of only a single software or digital asset type.

Are you interested in a career in cybersecurity and ethical hacking? Do you want to learn how to protect yourself and your organization from cyber threats? Look no further than "Learn Ethical Hacking in 15 Hours | Certificated CSEH+ 2023", the ultimate online course for learning how to hack ethically and improve your cybersecurity skills.

This course is designed to provide you with a comprehensive education in ethical hacking, covering everything from basic hacking concepts to advanced techniques used by professional cybersecurity experts. With 15 hours of content and over 100 lectures, you will learn how to perform real-world hacking scenarios, how to use popular hacking tools like Kali Linux, and how to defend against common cyber attacks.

The course is taught by certified cybersecurity experts who have years of experience in the field. They will guide you through each lesson, providing practical examples and step-by-step instructions to help you master each concept. You will also receive a certification upon completion of the course, which will demonstrate your skills and knowledge to potential employers.

In this course, you will learn:

  • The basics of ethical hacking, including different types of hacking and the mindset of a hacker

  • How to use Linux for ethical hacking, including popular tools like Kali Linux and Ubuntu

  • The different phases of hacking, including reconnaissance, scanning, and exploitation

  • How to perform advanced hacking techniques, including web application hacking and social engineering

  • How to protect against common cyber attacks, including denial-of-service attacks and malware infections

  • How to write ethical hacking reports and communicate your findings to clients

  • and other awesome and unique topics!

In this course, you will learn the basics of C++ programming, including syntax, data types, functions, and classes. You will also learn how to use C++ to build tools and applications that can be used for ethical hacking. These include keyloggers, network scanners, and password crackers, among others.

In addition to learning C++, this course will cover a range of other topics that are essential for ethical hacking. These include network security, web application security, cryptography, wireshark, nmap and penetration testing. You will also learn about the various certifications available for ethical hackers and how to prepare for them.

By the end of this course, you will have a solid understanding of ethical hacking and the role that C++ plays in it. You will also be prepared to take the Certified Secure Ethical Hacker (CSEH+) exam, which is recognized by leading companies in the cybersecurity industry.

So, whether you are new to programming or an experienced developer, this course is designed to help you become a certified ethical hacker and take your career to the next level. Enroll today and start your journey towards becoming a cybersecurity expert.

This course is suitable for beginners and professionals alike, with content that is designed to be accessible and engaging to learners of all levels. Enroll today and take the first step towards becoming a certified ethical hacker!
targetAudiences: Beginners who want to learn about ethical hacking and how to use Linux for penetration testing
IT professionals who want to improve their cybersecurity skills and knowledge

Introduction to the Program Management Module

The module introduces program management, highlighting its strategic role in managing related projects to achieve broader organizational goals. The session is divided into four stages:


  1. What is Program Management

  2. The Role of a Program Manager

  3. Understanding Projects – key stages, artifacts, documents, meetings, and activities.

  4. Program Management Methodologies – including benefits and challenges.


Key Concepts and Insights

What is Program Management?

  • Definition: Coordinated management of related projects for strategic alignment and value delivery.

  • Focuses on improving organizational performance, managing interdependencies, and delivering consolidated benefits.


The Role of a Program Manager

  • Operates at a strategic level to align projects with organizational objectives.

  • Distinct from a project manager, focusing on coordination, strategic outcomes, and long-term benefits.

  • Responsibilities include program planning, resource allocation, governance, and change management.


Strategic Program Alignment

  • Ensures programs contribute to organizational strategy through proper planning and alignment.

  • Involves stakeholder engagement, governance, and risk management.


Program Lifecycle Management

  • Phases include:

    • Initiation: Defining vision, stakeholders, and initial planning.

    • Planning: Roadmaps, risk assessment, and governance.

    • Execution & Monitoring: Tracking progress and benefits realization.

    • Closure: Consolidating outcomes and transitioning deliverables to operations.


Benefits Management

  • Focus on achieving long-term value through effective tracking, analysis, and transitioning deliverables into operations.


Stakeholder Engagement

  • Active management of relationships and communication to align stakeholder needs with program objectives.

  • Tools include communication plans and risk identification strategies.


Governance

  • Establishes a framework to ensure programs align with organizational policies and maintain transparency.


Key Takeaways

  • Program management delivers strategic benefits beyond individual projects.

  • Involves a lifecycle approach from initiation to closure, with a focus on long-term outcomes.

  • Core skills include strategic thinking, leadership, risk management, and stakeholder alignment.


Summary of the Program Management Module Detailed

This course is divided into 4 stages. The first one is “what is Program Management”, the second one is the role of a program manager, the third stage is “Understanding Programs: Key Stages, Artifacts, Documents, Meetings, and Activities”, and the last one focus on the methodologies, benefits and challenges.


This lesson is structured in eight stages, each diving into key aspects of program management:


Introduction to Program Management: We’ll start by understanding what program management is, its importance, and how it differs from project management. This includes exploring the definition, key objectives and expected outcomes, along with its history and evolution.


Then, we will have the Key Functions and Responsibilities as a Program Manager: This section will examine the strategic role of a program manager, their essential competencies and critical responsibilities, such as strategic planning, stakeholder management, risk, and quality governance.


The Program Management Lifecycle: Here, we’ll cover the program management stages, from initiation to closure, along with important artifacts and documents like the program charter, benefits realization plan, and risk register.


Key Functions in Program Management: This part will emphasize strategic alignment, benefits management, resource allocation, and financial oversight, focusing on metrics that track program performance and impact.


Methodologies and Frameworks in Program Management: We’ll dive into common frameworks such as Managing Successful Programmes (MSP), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), and hybrid models, along with essential tools for program oversight.


Challenges in Program Management: In this section, we’ll discuss challenges like cross-project dependencies, stakeholder expectations, scope creep, and solutions for communication breakdowns and resource constraints.


Advanced Program Management Techniques: This includes leadership approaches, adaptive communication, and ethical decision-making, along with case studies that highlight best practices in successful programs.


Program Management Benefits, Metrics, and Evaluation: We’ll conclude by discussing metrics for assessing program impact, long-term benefits realization, and continuous improvement for future programs.


Throughout these lessons, you will gain insights into the comprehensive scope of program management, its methodologies, and the skills required to ensure successful program outcomes.


This structure will reinforce the strategic importance of program management in achieving organizational goals.


What is Project Management?

Project management is the organized application of knowledge, processes, skills, and tools to guide a project from its beginning to its successful completion. It involves:

  • Defining goals: Deciding what the project should achieve.

  • Planning: Mapping out the steps and resources needed.

  • Executing: Putting the plan into action, directing the team, and managing resources.

  • Monitoring and controlling: Tracking progress, managing changes, and addressing issues.

  • Closing: Reviewing the project, documenting results, and learning from the experience.


What is Business Project Management?

Business project management refers to applying project management principles within a business setting. These projects focus on achieving business objectives such as:

  • Launching new products or services

  • Improving or automating business processes

  • Restructuring departments

  • Implementing new software systems


The Role of Project Management

Project management plays a critical role in businesses because it:

  • Increases Efficiency: A well-defined project plan helps streamline work and avoid wasted effort.

  • Ensures Results: Project management keeps the focus on meeting defined goals within time and budget restrictions.

  • Manages Risk: Potential problems are anticipated and mitigated through careful planning and monitoring.

  • Improves Communication: Clear communication channels among team members, stakeholders, and clients help avoid misunderstandings.

  • Improves Client Satisfaction: Successful project completion within agreed-upon parameters builds trust with clients.


Why is Learning Project Management Important for Companies?

Companies invest in their employees' project management training because:

Competitive Advantage: Companies with strong project management capabilities deliver projects more successfully, gain a reputation for reliability, and outperform competitors.

Reduces Costs: Inefficient projects cost more due to delays and wasted resources. Project management helps optimize resources.

Enhances Employee Morale: Well-run projects minimize stress, improve team collaboration, and create a sense of accomplishment.

Improves Innovation: Structured project management allows for managing innovation projects, leading to a culture of innovation within the company.


How Project Management Skills Boost Your Career

Developing your project management skills can significantly enhance your career prospects:

High Demand: Project managers are in demand across industries like IT, construction, healthcare, etc.

Better Salary: Skilled project managers often earn higher salaries due to their expertise.

Leadership Potential: Project management provides a solid foundation for taking on leadership roles within organizations.

Versatility: Project management skills apply to a wide range of jobs and roles, not just project management positions.

Personal Growth: You'll build organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills, making you an asset to any team
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in Project Management

Data analysis also is the process of collecting, cleaning, and organizing data to uncover patterns, insights, and trends that can help individuals and organizations make informed decisions. It involves examining raw data to find answers to specific questions, identify potential problems, or discover opportunities for improvement.  


Data analysts transform raw data into actionable insights to help organisations improve operations, strategies, and customer experiences. Core skills include statistical analysis, critical thinking, data visualisation, and proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.


Learning data analysis skills is crucial for career building in today's data-driven world, both for professional positions and managers of all levels. Here's why:  


For Professionals:

Increased Employability: Data analysis skills are in high demand across various industries. Professionals with these skills are more likely to secure well-paying jobs and advance in their careers.  

Improved Decision-Making: Data analysis enables professionals to make informed decisions based on evidence and insights rather than relying on intuition or guesswork.  

Enhanced Problem-Solving: Data analysis helps professionals identify the root causes of problems, develop effective solutions, and track the effectiveness of interventions.  

Increased Efficiency and Productivity: By automating tasks and identifying areas for improvement, data analysis can help professionals work more efficiently and increase their productivity.  


For Managers:

Strategic Planning: Data analysis provides managers with the insights needed to develop effective strategies, set realistic goals, and track progress towards objectives.  

Performance Management: Managers can use data to monitor team performance, identify areas for improvement, and provide targeted feedback to employees.  

Risk Management: Data analysis can help managers identify potential risks, assess their impact, and develop mitigation strategies.  

Innovation and Growth: By analyzing data on customer behavior, market trends, and competitor activities, managers can identify opportunities for innovation and growth.  


Learning data analysis skills is essential for professionals and managers of all levels who want to succeed in today's data-driven world. These skills can help individuals make better decisions, solve problems more effectively, and contribute to the success of their organizations.

  4. Program Management Methodologies – including benefits and challenges.


Key Concepts and Insights

What is Program Management?

  • Definition: Coordinated management of related projects for strategic alignment and value delivery.

  • Focuses on improving organizational performance, managing interdependencies, and delivering consolidated benefits.


The Role of a Program Manager

  • Operates at a strategic level to align projects with organizational objectives.

  • Distinct from a project manager, focusing on coordination, strategic outcomes, and long-term benefits.

  • Responsibilities include program planning, resource allocation, governance, and change management.


Strategic Program Alignment

  • Ensures programs contribute to organizational strategy through proper planning and alignment.

  • Involves stakeholder engagement, governance, and risk management.


Program Lifecycle Management

  • Phases include:

    • Initiation: Defining vision, stakeholders, and initial planning.

    • Planning: Roadmaps, risk assessment, and governance.

    • Execution & Monitoring: Tracking progress and benefits realization.

    • Closure: Consolidating outcomes and transitioning deliverables to operations.


Benefits Management

  • Focus on achieving long-term value through effective tracking, analysis, and transitioning deliverables into operations.


Stakeholder Engagement

  • Active management of relationships and communication to align stakeholder needs with program objectives.

  • Tools include communication plans and risk identification strategies.


Governance

  • Establishes a framework to ensure programs align with organizational policies and maintain transparency.


Key Takeaways

  • Program management delivers strategic benefits beyond individual projects.

  • Involves a lifecycle approach from initiation to closure, with a focus on long-term outcomes.

  • Core skills include strategic thinking, leadership, risk management, and stakeholder alignment.


Summary of the Program Management Course Detailed

This course is divided into 4 stages. The first one is “what is Program Management”, the second one is the role of a program manager, the third stage is “Understanding Programs: Key Stages, Artifacts, Documents, Meetings, and Activities”, and the last one focus on the methodologies, benefits and challenges.


This lesson is structured in eight stages, each diving into key aspects of program management:


Introduction to Program Management: We’ll start by understanding what program management is, its importance, and how it differs from project management. This includes exploring the definition, key objectives and expected outcomes, along with its history and evolution.


Then, we will have the Key Functions and Responsibilities as a Program Manager: This section will examine the strategic role of a program manager, their essential competencies and critical responsibilities, such as strategic planning, stakeholder management, risk, and quality governance.


The Program Management Lifecycle: Here, we’ll cover the program management stages, from initiation to closure, along with important artifacts and documents like the program charter, benefits realization plan, and risk register.


Key Functions in Program Management: This part will emphasize strategic alignment, benefits management, resource allocation, and financial oversight, focusing on metrics that track program performance and impact.


Methodologies and Frameworks in Program Management: We’ll dive into common frameworks such as Managing Successful Programmes (MSP), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), and hybrid models, along with essential tools for program oversight.


Challenges in Program Management: In this section, we’ll discuss challenges like cross-project dependencies, stakeholder expectations, scope creep, and solutions for communication breakdowns and resource constraints.


Advanced Program Management Techniques: This includes leadership approaches, adaptive communication, and ethical decision-making, along with case studies that highlight best practices in successful programs.


Program Management Benefits, Metrics, and Evaluation: We’ll conclude by discussing metrics for assessing program impact, long-term benefits realization, and continuous improvement for future programs.


Throughout these lessons, you will gain insights into the comprehensive scope of program management, its methodologies, and the skills required to ensure successful program outcomes.


This structure will reinforce the strategic importance of program management in achieving organizational goals.

courseDetails.title: Beginner's SEO Guide: SEO Fundamentals for Beginners
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master the Essentials of Search Engine Optimization to Boost Your Online Visibility and Drive Organic Traffic
courseDetails.longDescription:
Unlock the potential of your online presence with our comprehensive course, Beginner's SEO Guide: SEO Fundamentals for Beginners! In today's digital landscape, understanding Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is crucial for anyone looking to enhance their visibility and drive organic traffic to their website. Whether you're a small business owner, a marketing professional, or a content creator, mastering SEO can open doors to new opportunities and help you achieve your goals.


This course is meticulously designed for beginners, guiding you through the essential concepts and practical strategies needed to succeed in SEO. You’ll start by learning how search engines operate, the critical role of keywords, and the factors that influence search rankings. We break down complex topics into easily digestible lessons, ensuring you build a solid foundation in SEO principles.


Throughout the course, you'll discover the significance of on-page and off-page SEO, with practical exercises that allow you to apply what you've learned. You’ll delve into crafting compelling title tags and meta descriptions, creating engaging content that resonates with your audience, and implementing effective internal and external linking strategies to boost your site's authority. Our easy-to-follow lessons will equip you with the skills to enhance your content, making it more attractive to both users and search engines.


Additionally, we’ll explore the importance of technical SEO, including website structure, mobile optimization, and site speed—key elements that contribute to a seamless user experience. You'll learn how to use powerful tools like Google Analytics and Google Search Console to monitor your website's performance and make data-driven decisions to improve your SEO strategy continuously.


By the end of this course, you will be able to create a comprehensive SEO plan tailored to your specific business goals. You will have the confidence to implement effective SEO techniques that improve your search rankings and attract more visitors to your site. With lifetime access to course materials, you can revisit lessons at any time, ensuring you stay updated on the latest SEO trends and best practices.


Join us today and start your journey toward mastering SEO! With practical exercises, real-world examples, and a supportive community, you'll have everything you need to transform your online presence. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to boost your website’s performance and reach your target audience effectively. Enroll now and take the first step toward SEO success!
targetAudiences: Small Business Owners and Entrepreneurs: This group includes individuals who own or manage small businesses and want to improve their online presence. They seek to understand the basics of SEO to drive more traffic to their websites, attract local customers, and ultimately increase sales without relying heavily on paid advertising

Marketing Professionals and Digital Marketers: This group consists of individuals working in marketing or aspiring to enter the field of digital marketing. They are looking to enhance their skills in SEO to better support their organizations' online marketing strategies, improve website visibility, and achieve higher search engine rankings for their clients or businesses

Content Creators and Bloggers: This group includes writers, bloggers, and content creators who want to learn how to optimize their content for search engines. They are interested in understanding how to attract more readers and engage their audience by applying SEO techniques to their writing and online publications

courseDetails.title: Gestão de Empresas e Empreendedorismo
courseDetails.shortDescription: Geração de Ideias, Planeamento Empresarial, Financiar o seu Negócio, Considerações Jurídicas, Marketing e Vendas
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao programa: Programa Avançado em Negócios e Empreendedorismo


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

O MTF é o instituto global de educação e pesquisa com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado em educação híbrida (presencial e online) para negócios e profissionais nas áreas: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de P&D do MTF concentra-se em atividades de pesquisa nas áreas: Inteligência Artificial, Machine Learning, Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico, Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, membro da Câmara de Comércio e Indústria Portuguesa.

O MTF está presente em 215 países e já foi escolhido por mais de 560 000 alunos.


Autor do Curso: O Dr. João Martins é um gestor e empreendedor experiente, com mais de 30 anos de experiência em cargos de alta gestão nos setores de telecomunicações e TI. Começando num ambiente académico, onde obteve o seu doutoramento em Engenharia e um MBA na Universidade Nova de Lisboa, evoluiu rapidamente para cargos de C-suite no ambiente corporativo, tanto em grandes empresas como em startups. Atualmente é administrador e acionista de uma startup integradora de TI em Lisboa, focada em cibersegurança. Apaixonado por educação, é também Professor convidado na Nova Information Management School, lecionando Gestão do Conhecimento e Análise Financeira a alunos de pós-graduação e graduação.


O curso "Introdução ao Empreendedorismo" é projetado para permitir uma compreensão básica do empreendedorismo, a sua importância na economia moderna e as skills essenciais necessárias para ter sucesso como empreendedor.

Ao longo do curso, os alunos irão explorar vários aspetos do empreendedorismo, incluindo geração de ideias, planeamento de negócios, financiamento, marketing e operações.

O curso também aprofunda as características que definem empreendedores de sucesso e as diferenças entre empreendedorismo e propriedade de pequenas empresas.

Serão utilizados estudos de caso reais para ilustrar a aplicação destes conceitos em cenários práticos.

No final do curso, os alunos terão uma compreensão abrangente do que é necessário para iniciar e crescer um negócio de sucesso e estarão equipados com o conhecimento para navegar nos desafios do empreendedorismo.


Empreendedorismo é o processo de identificar oportunidades, inovar e assumir riscos para criar e gerir um empreendimento comercial. Envolve a vontade de suportar a incerteza e a capacidade de adaptação a circunstâncias em mudança para alcançar o sucesso. Empreendedores são indivíduos que embarcam nesta jornada, utilizando a sua criatividade, visão e determinação para dar vida às suas ideias. Existem várias razões principais pelas quais os indivíduos optam por se tornar empreendedores e construir os seus próprios negócios:


Busca pela Paixão: Muitos empreendedores são movidos pela paixão por uma determinada ideia, produto ou serviço. Eles querem concretizar a sua visão e causar um impacto significativo na sua área de atuação.

  • Independência Financeira: Construir um negócio de sucesso pode proporcionar liberdade e independência financeira. Os empreendedores têm a oportunidade de criar riqueza para si e para as suas famílias, capitalizando as suas próprias ideias e trabalho árduo.

  • Flexibilidade e Autonomia: O empreendedorismo oferece a flexibilidade de definir o seu próprio horário e trabalhar em projetos que se alinhem com os seus valores e objetivos pessoais. Os empreendedores têm autonomia para tomar decisões e moldar a direção dos seus negócios como acharem melhor.

  • Desejo de Inovação: O empreendedorismo é frequentemente impulsionado pelo desejo de inovar e criar algo novo. Os empreendedores procuram resolver problemas, revolucionar indústrias e apresentar soluções inovadoras que melhorem a vida das pessoas.

  • Crescimento Pessoal e Realização: Construir um negócio pode ser uma experiência profundamente gratificante que promove o crescimento pessoal e a realização. Os empreendedores enfrentam desafios, superam obstáculos e aprendem lições valiosas ao longo do caminho, o que pode levar a uma sensação de realização e satisfação.


Aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer conhecimentos e habilidades essenciais que apoiam o processo de construção de uma carreira e lançamento de uma startup. Algumas maneiras pelas quais aprender sobre negócios pode ser benéfico incluem:


Compreender a Dinâmica do Mercado: Uma sólida compreensão dos princípios de negócios pode ajudar os empreendedores a identificar oportunidades de mercado, avaliar a procura pelos seus produtos ou serviços e desenvolver estratégias eficazes para alcançar o seu público-alvo.

Gestão Financeira: Aprender sobre finanças e contabilidade é crucial para gerir os aspetos financeiros de um negócio, incluindo orçamento, previsão e gestão de fluxo de caixa. Esse conhecimento é essencial para tomar decisões informadas e garantir a saúde financeira de uma startup.

Marketing e Vendas: Estratégias eficazes de marketing e vendas são essenciais para atrair clientes e fazer crescer um negócio. Aprender sobre princípios de marketing, branding e aquisição de clientes pode ajudar os empreendedores a desenvolver estratégias para promover eficazmente os seus produtos ou serviços e impulsionar as vendas.

Liderança e Gestão: Aprender sobre os princípios de liderança e gestão pode ajudar os empreendedores a construir e liderar equipas de alto desempenho, delegar tarefas de forma eficaz e criar uma cultura de trabalho positiva dentro das suas organizações. No geral, aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer aos empreendedores o conhecimento, as habilidades e a confiança de que precisam para navegar pelos desafios do empreendedorismo, construir negócios de sucesso e atingir os seus objetivos.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Gestão

courseDetails.title: Simple React App from Scratch
courseDetails.shortDescription: The foundation for starting a robust React app!
courseDetails.longDescription:
Through this course, you will learn how to build powerful and responsive web applications using the latest React technology, while leveraging the power of Vite to streamline your development process.
Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer looking to take your skills to the next level, this course has something for you.
In fact, this course covers everything you need to know to start building your own React projects from scratch.

You will learn how to set up a Vite environment and use it to develop and deploy a simple React application, as well as how to work with components and UI additions with Chakra.

With a focus on best practices and real-world examples, this course will give you the skills and knowledge you need to build high-performance React applications with Vite.

You will learn the basics of React, including JSX, components, and state management, as well as the Vite development environment, which allows for fast and efficient development with React.

With hands-on coding exercises, real-world projects, and expert instruction, you'll be ready to build powerful, responsive web apps with React and Vite.

Start learning the fundamental knowledge today to becoming an amazing React developer in the near future!
targetAudiences: Want to learn the power of React
Quickly building a React website in less than one hour
Learn how to install third-party libraries in a React project

courseDetails.title: Non-Engineers’ Guide to Tech Study Abroad: MS, Tech MBA, PhD
courseDetails.shortDescription: Unlock Masters and PhD Programs in Tech, Analytics, Interdisciplinary Studies, and Beyond at Top-Ranked Unis Worldwide
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you a non-engineeer who’s been told that the doors to a tech career are closed?


You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take. Stop self-rejecting before you even try.


Let me share my story. I was told countless times that I wasn’t “technical enough” to make it. With an Economics background, I initially felt unsure about my prospects in the tech world. But I didn’t let that stop me, I secured a spot in a top Data Science program at my dream university. Now, I’m here to guide you through that same process.


At Philosophers Who Code, our mission is to turn thinkers into builders and we will teach you:


  • Proven Strategies: Learn how to leverage your Liberal Arts or non-technical background to create a compelling application for top technical programs. We’ll show you how to transform your existing skills into assets that make you stand out.


  • Application Hacks & Insider Tips: We’ve been there and done that, so we know the unique challenges of transitioning from a non-technical background. Our course includes insider tips and hacks to overcome common obstacles, from networking strategies to nailing your interviews.


  • Real-World Success Stories: Gain insights from real-world Letters of Recommendation (LOR) and Statements of Purpose (SOP) from candidates who have successfully made the transition to tech. These examples will help you craft your own winning documents.


  • Cheat Sheets & Tracking Tools: Stay organized and on top of your applications with our exclusive cheat sheets and tracking tools. These resources are designed to keep you focused and ensure you don’t miss any critical steps in the application process.


  • Scholarship Lists & Program Recommendations: We’ll provide you with curated lists of the best programs to target, along with available scholarships that can help you finance your education. These resources will save you hours of research and increase your chances of success.


  • Step-by-Step Guidance: From crafting a compelling Statement of Purpose to preparing for interviews, we’ll guide you through every step of the application process. You’ll also learn strategies to excel post-admission, ensuring you not only get into a top university but also thrive in your studies and future career.


Who is this course for?


  • Non-engineers, including graduates of Liberal Arts, Social Sciences, Commerce, and equivalent international programs, who are considering a career shift into tech.


  • Professionals seeking to enhance their skills and qualifications through advanced technical study abroad programs.


  • Anyone ready to break barriers and unlock new career opportunities through world-class education.


Whether you’re aiming for Data Science, a Tech MBA, or any other technical field, We’ll help you navigate the path to success at top-ranked universities worldwide.
targetAudiences: Perfect for Non-Engineers Seeking Higher Education in Tech: Whether your background is in Liberal Arts, Social Sciences, Commerce, or similar fields, this course is your gateway to pursuing tech fields like Data Science, Tech MBA, and more through top international programs.

courseDetails.title: Process Improvement with automation: Certification
courseDetails.shortDescription: Upskill in process improvement and automation, delivering highly effective, automated processes in your organization
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course carefully infuses the important topics of process improvement and automation together - showing you how to deliver them both in tandem, for the benefit of your organization. Process improvement is an enduring skill you should have at all times, with automation being a skill you should obtain now to help future proof your career prospects.

Being able to improve processes through the use of automation is a skill highly in demand today and will be for a long time to come. It enables you to improve the productivity, efficiency and effectiveness of your business, freeing up time, budgets and resource to be deployed elsewhere. In this course, we will:

- Look at the end to end process to deploy automation through process improvement.

- Look at what we mean by process, process improvement and automation.

- Use a scenario example to build out a real life example of how this is done.

- Highlight how to map out current and future state processes.

- Learn how to run such a project, including design, delivery and post-deployment.

By the end of this course, you will be able to get going day 1 on the deployment of automation into your business through process improvement projects, making an instant impact.
targetAudiences: Anyone working in an organization, interacting daily with business processes
Anyone looking to get skills in the space of process improvement
Anyone looking to get skills in the space of automation - future proofing their skillset
Analysts, Project Managers, Team Leaders, Business Owners, Managers etc. all will get something from this course

What is Office Administration Management?

Office Administration Management focuses on ensuring the smooth, efficient, and organized operation of an office environment. This includes tasks vital to the success of any company, whether small or large. Key areas include:

  • Resource Management: Overseeing office supplies, equipment, facilities, and budgets.

  • Information Management: Handling records, data organization, mail handling, and creating effective filing systems.

  • Communication: Managing phone calls, emails, internal memos, and external communications, ensuring clear information flow.

  • Staff Support: Supporting employees by coordinating schedules, managing payroll, and assisting with HR functions.

  • Project & Event Coordination: Planning meetings, conferences, travel arrangements, and other business events.


Main Functionality of an Office Administration Manager

The Office Administration Manager is the backbone of a well-run office. Their primary responsibilities include:

  • Overseeing Daily Operations: Ensuring all the gears of the office are turning smoothly, from supply orders to communication channels.

  • Problem Solving: Anticipating issues, troubleshooting problems, and implementing solutions as challenges arise.

  • Process Improvement: Identifying areas where efficiency can be optimized and streamlining existing administrative systems.

  • Supervision & Leadership: Guiding and supporting other administrative staff, providing training, and fostering a positive work environment.

  • Budgeting & Financial Oversight: Tracking expenses, preparing reports, and maintaining financial records.


How Office Administration Management Skills Build Your Career

Investing in developing your Office Administration Management skills offers numerous career advantages:

  • Increased Value: The ability to manage administrative operations effectively makes you indispensable in any business setting.

  • Transferable Skills: Skills honed in office administration, like communication, organization, and problem-solving, are in demand in virtually every industry.

  • Leadership Potential: Strong office management experience prepares you for supervisory roles and more advanced positions in management.

  • Varied Career Paths: Office administration offers room for growth into specialized fields such as human resources, project management, or executive assisting.

  • Entrepreneurial Opportunities: A solid administrative foundation is invaluable if you aim to one day launch your own business.

Welcome to Learning & Exploring Civil Engineering Concepts & Softwares Practically.

Autodesk Revit is a building information modelling software tool for architects, landscape architects, structural engineers, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing (MEP) engineers, designers and contractors. The software allows users to design a building and structure and its components in 3D, annotate the model with 2D drafting elements, and access building information from the building model's database. Revit is 4D building information modeling application capable with tools to plan and track various stages in the building's lifecycle, from concept to construction and later maintenance and/or demolition.

Take your Revit skills to the Advanced level. First, get comfortable with the Revit environment, and learn to set up a project and add the grids, levels, and dimensions that will anchor your design. Then we dive into modeling: adding walls, doors, and windows; creating and mirroring groups; linking to DWG files; and working with floors, roofs, and ceilings. I will also shows advanced techniques for modeling stairs and complex walls, adding rooms, and creating schedules. Finally, discover how to annotate your drawing so all the components are perfectly understood, and learn how to output sheets to PDF and AutoCAD.

Finally i will also covers basics to Intermediate level of dynamo in Revit.

One of the core components of the course is the exploration and practical use of Metasploitable 2, a purposely vulnerable virtual machine that provides a safe environment for hands-on learning and experimentation.

The course covers essential techniques such as network scanning to identify IP addresses within a network. Students learn about banner grabbing, a method to gather information about a target system, including the operating system, software versions, and more. Understanding port numbers and their associated services is a crucial aspect of the course, particularly focusing on commonly exploited ports like FTP (Port 21), SSH (Port 22), Telnet (Port 23), SMTP (Port 25), HTTP (Port 80), and ports 139, 445, and 1099.

FTP, SSH, Telnet, SMTP, and HTTP are explored in detail, discussing their functionalities, vulnerabilities, and potential security risks. Practical exercises involve utilizing ethical hacking techniques to assess and secure these services, thereby preparing students to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities in real-world scenarios.

By the end of "Ethically Hack the Planet Part 2," participants will have a comprehensive understanding of network security, ethical hacking methodologies, and the tools necessary to assess and fortify network infrastructures against potential cyber threats. The course empowers individuals to use their knowledge and skills for constructive purposes, promoting a safer and more secure digital landscape."
targetAudiences: For IT beginners and ethical hackers.

courseDetails.title: Matlab course for wireless communication engineering
courseDetails.shortDescription: A step by step the Matlab codes for BER estimations of different Comm. systems like OFDM and NOMA Comm. systems
courseDetails.longDescription:
This is course is designed for under and post graduate students associated to the electronics and communication engineering department. It has 10 introductions of 30 minutes, each introduction discusses the theoretical explanation and the simulated figures that obtained through the explanation of the course. This course saves many months of hard work.

Using the Matlab program, you will learn:

1-How to estimate the Bit-Error-Rate (BER) performance of different modulation schemes like BPSK, QPSK, 16QAM, 64QAM, and 256QAM over an Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) channel?

2-How to generate and add a Rayleigh fading channel based on the Jakes model?

3-How to mitigate the Rayleigh fading channel effect using different linear equalizer schemes?

4-How to estimate the Bit-Error-Rate (BER) performance over Single-Input-Single-Output Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (SISO-OFDM) communication system over a Rayleigh fading channel?

5-How to extend this work for different Multiple-Input-Multiple-Output (MIMO) configurations like 2×2, and 3×3 MIMO-OFDM communication systems over a Rayleigh fading channel?

6-A general code for BER estimation in case of Nt×Nr configuration for OFDM communication system over a Rayleigh fading channel will be presented, where Nt, is the number of transmitting antennas, and Nr is the number of receiving antennas.

7-Finally, the BER estimation for Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA), which used in the 5G communication systems will be presented.
targetAudiences: This is course is designed for under and postgraduate students associated with the electronics and communication engineering department

Management learning is critically important for both companies and individual managers, as it plays a pivotal role in achieving organizational success, fostering leadership skills, and advancing individual careers. Here's why management learning is significant for companies and managers:


For Companies:

Enhanced Productivity and Efficiency: Effective management practices help streamline workflows, allocate resources efficiently, and optimize processes. When managers are well-versed in management principles, companies can operate more productively, leading to cost savings and improved profitability.


Innovation and Adaptability: In a rapidly changing business environment, companies must continuously innovate and adapt. Management learning equips managers with the tools and knowledge to foster a culture of innovation and navigate through evolving market conditions.


Employee Engagement and Retention: Skilled managers can create a positive work environment, motivate employees, and build strong teams. This leads to higher employee engagement and lower turnover rates, reducing recruitment and training costs for the company.


Strategic Decision-Making: Management education provides managers with the ability to make informed, data-driven decisions. Strategic thinking and decision-making skills are essential for achieving long-term business goals.


Conflict Resolution and Communication: Effective communication and conflict resolution are vital in any organization. Managers with management training are better equipped to handle conflicts, promote teamwork, and maintain a harmonious workplace.


Risk Management: Companies face various risks, from financial to operational and reputational. Management learning helps managers identify, assess, and mitigate these risks, ensuring the company's stability and sustainability.


Customer Satisfaction: Managers with a deep understanding of management principles are more likely to focus on customer needs and satisfaction. This customer-centric approach can lead to increased loyalty and revenue.


For Managers:

Career Advancement: Management learning is crucial for career growth. Employers often prioritize candidates with management education and experience when filling leadership positions.


Leadership Development: Management education enhances leadership skills, including decision-making, problem-solving, and team management. These skills are transferable and valuable throughout one's career.


Increased Confidence: Managers who undergo management training gain confidence in their abilities. This confidence translates into better leadership and a greater capacity to handle challenging situations.


Networking Opportunities: Management courses and programs often facilitate networking with peers and industry experts. Building a strong professional network can open doors to new opportunities and insights.


Personal Growth: Management learning is not only about career advancement but also personal growth. It encourages self-reflection, self-improvement, and a better understanding of one's strengths and weaknesses.


Adaptation to Change: In today's dynamic business world, the ability to adapt to change is essential. Management education equips managers with the skills to thrive in uncertain and evolving environments.


Job Satisfaction: Effective management leads to more successful teams and projects, which can result in greater job satisfaction for managers. A fulfilling career is often linked to the ability to manage and lead effectively.


In conclusion, management learning is vital for both companies and managers. It empowers organizations to operate efficiently, innovate, and achieve their goals while providing managers with the tools and knowledge needed for career growth, personal development, and effective leadership. A strong foundation in management principles benefits everyone involved and contributes to long-term success.

courseDetails.title: SQL for Data Analysis, Hands-on industry skills for analysts
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master SQL for data analysis / science / querying. Learn from an expert: applicable to PostgreSQL ; MySQL ; AWS ; Azure
courseDetails.longDescription:
SQL really is the language of Data Analysis. 


  • This course will teach you the most useful querying techniques for industry.

  • Unlike other courses you'll be taught with industry-style data.

Learning to use SQL well, allows you to query the data in your organisation's databases so that you can answer the questions you have as a data and business professional. It is the "bread and butter" skill that data professionals have used for decades and it's as in-demand today as its ever been - especially on the cloud!.


I've put together all of the useful topics I already teach in my day-job, into one convenient course for you!


For anyone wanting to move into the field of Data Analysis or Data Science, or those who have only worked with spreadsheets, or relied on others to query the data for them, this course will help you grasp the most useful SQL functionality and enable you to grow in your role.. even if you have no programming experience. Once you have that skill to query data in different ways and without reliance on others, you'll be able to find useful ways to extract it and analyse it. It's only then that you gain insight into what organisational databases hold.


This course comes with a financial database based upon an insurance claims model (something easily understood) which you'll learn to query and build your skills with. All the lessons and exercises will be based on this database so you'll have the freedom to explore  and investigate relationships in the data that other courses aren't usually able to offer. You'll have access to all of the code used by the instructor so you can follow along,  as well as the solution to exercises that you'll use to shore-up your skills. You'll also have access to me through Q&A of-course!


The techniques you learn can be applied on multiple platforms. Whether you are using PostgreSQL, MySQL, AWS Athena, or any other environment that requires SQL for querying. Once you get started, you'll quickly be able to adapt what you learn for use anywhere.


We'll take you through from the very basics, through to advanced functionality most commonly used in industry and not just the vanilla content you'll see in most other courses. You'll soon be a SQL hero.


So what are you waiting for?

courseDetails.title: Linode: Deploy Scalable React Web Apps on the Cloud
courseDetails.shortDescription: Cloud Computing | IaaS | Server Configuration | Linux Foundations | Database Servers | LAMP Stack | Server Security
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to our latest course, where you will have the opportunity to build customizable and highly scalable React Web Apps on Linode. In this course, you will learn the skills necessary to set up and deploy a remote instance on Linode, as well as the foundational knowledge of Linux and Ubuntu, web servers, and databases. By the end of the course, you will have built and deployed a fully functional E-Commerce site on a remote cloud server.

In the first section of the course, we will introduce you to the basics of cloud computing and the different service models available, including IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS. You will learn about the advantages of using cloud computing and how it can benefit your projects.

Next, we will guide you through the process of setting up a Linode account and deploying a remote instance on the platform. This will include configuring your instance, setting up networking, and securing your instance with firewalls.

In the third section, we will delve into the foundations of Linux and Ubuntu. You will learn the basics of the command line interface, file system navigation, and basic Linux commands. This will be essential for managing your remote instance on Linode.

We will then cover the basics of web servers and databases, including LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MariaDB, and PHP). You will learn how to install and configure LAMP stack, as well as how to use it to serve your web applications.

In the fifth section, we will focus on server security, including network and software firewalls. You will learn how to secure your server and protect it from potential threats using popular utilities like UFW, and custom Port configurations.

From there, we demonstrate how to scale servers vertically and horizontally using application load balancers. This will include using web servers like Apache and Nginx to distribute traffic and ensure high availability for your web applications.

Finally, we will delve into the world of React.JS. You will learn how to build a calculator, a connect-4 game, and an e-commerce site using React. You will learn about the basics of React components, state, and props, and how to use them to build dynamic, interactive web applications.

By the end of this course, you will have a solid understanding of how to use Linode to set up and deploy remote instances, as well as the foundational knowledge of Linux, web servers, and databases. You will also have the skills to build dynamic and interactive web applications using React.JS.

This course is designed for developers who are new to cloud computing and want to learn how to use Linode to build web applications. Some basic knowledge of web development and programming concepts is recommended but not required.

If you're ready to take your cloud computing and web development skills to the next level, this course is the perfect place to start! Sign up now to get started.
targetAudiences: Students interested in Cloud Computing
Students interested in Remote Server Deployment, Configuration and Administration
Students interested in Web Server and Database Server Foundations
Students interested in Building Interactive Web Apps using ReactJS

courseDetails.longDescription:
Begin your AI journey with Automated Machine Learning!

This course focuses on giving you the big picture of Artificial Intelligence: the streamlined process of creating AI machine learning models. Leave the mathematical equations and Python coding aside and concentrate on what really matters!


Course Architecture guarantees Best Cognitive Learning Outcomes

Richard Shinn, PhD in AI and CEO of AIBrain, is the Chief Architect behind this course. He designed the entire course structure to help learners acquire cognitive skills; learning by examples first, then learning based on denotational semantics and operational semantics. This two-step approach is particularly useful when we deal with the complexity of real-world problems.


Learn Hands-On

From day 1, you will learn hands-on skills. You will follow our lab instructors to build Machine Learning models with AutoML. By the end of the course, you will be able to build a working AI-powered mobile app. Following Richard Feynman’s principle “What I cannot create, I do not understand” we teach practical knowledge from day one.

Deepen your Skills

To make sure that you will get a deep understanding of all the topics, you will have practical homework assignments accompanying all labs. Each lab has its own homework assignments to help you deepen the skills learned during the course. 

Gain a Certificate from a Leading AI Company

Kick-start your career in AI with an official certificate from a leading AI company! Upon completion of the course, you will be awarded with a verified certificate of completion. 

Complete a Term Project: Build your own ML Model

As part of this course, you will ideate your own AI-powered product that leverages Machine Learning. You will build a simple low-fidelity prototype of an AI-powered application before building a custom Machine Learning model with AutoML for your idea.

Get 1-1 Advice and Guidance

Join the AI School Community

Use our vivid AISchool Community and Discord channel to discuss with your peers and leverage the power of community. Share your questions and answers with lab instructors and fellow students. 

Evaluate your Progress

During your journey, you will always have the possibility to evaluate your progress and understanding of the materials through quizzes. This will help you to constantly measure your success and help to check your understanding of core concepts. 

Build your Professional Network

Stay in touch with your peers and leverage a professional network of like-minded AI practitioners. In our community, we provide a dedicated alumni channel for all successful graduates of our course.




The course takes you through 4 carefully structured topics.

Topic 1

Introduction to Automated Machine Learning

Find out how AutoML is transforming the data science game by enabling anyone to build machine learning models without a single line of code. Familiarize yourself with the 5-Step ML Pipeline to solve any Machine Learning problem, before building your very first AI-powered smartphone application in 30 minutes.

Easily deploy models on to your device and test it in real world settings.

What is Project Management?

Project management is the organized application of knowledge, processes, skills, and tools to guide a project from its beginning to its successful completion. It involves:

  • Defining goals: Deciding what the project should achieve.

  • Planning: Mapping out the steps and resources needed.

  • Executing: Putting the plan into action, directing the team, and managing resources.

  • Monitoring and controlling: Tracking progress, managing changes, and addressing issues.

  • Closing: Reviewing the project, documenting results, and learning from the experience.


What is Business Project Management?

Business project management refers to applying project management principles within a business setting. These projects focus on achieving business objectives such as:

  • Launching new products or services

  • Improving or automating business processes

  • Restructuring departments

  • Implementing new software systems


The Role of Project Management

Project management plays a critical role in businesses because it:

  • Increases Efficiency: A well-defined project plan helps streamline work and avoid wasted effort.

  • Ensures Results: Project management keeps the focus on meeting defined goals within time and budget restrictions.

  • Manages Risk: Potential problems are anticipated and mitigated through careful planning and monitoring.

  • Improves Communication: Clear communication channels among team members, stakeholders, and clients help avoid misunderstandings.

  • Improves Client Satisfaction: Successful project completion within agreed-upon parameters builds trust with clients.


Why is Learning Project Management Important for Companies?

Companies invest in their employees' project management training because:

Competitive Advantage: Companies with strong project management capabilities deliver projects more successfully, gain a reputation for reliability, and outperform competitors.

Reduces Costs: Inefficient projects cost more due to delays and wasted resources. Project management helps optimize resources.

Enhances Employee Morale: Well-run projects minimize stress, improve team collaboration, and create a sense of accomplishment.

Improves Innovation: Structured project management allows for managing innovation projects, leading to a culture of innovation within the company.


How Project Management Skills Boost Your Career

Developing your project management skills can significantly enhance your career prospects:

High Demand: Project managers are in demand across industries like IT, construction, healthcare, etc.

Better Salary: Skilled project managers often earn higher salaries due to their expertise.

Leadership Potential: Project management provides a solid foundation for taking on leadership roles within organizations.

Versatility: Project management skills apply to a wide range of jobs and roles, not just project management positions.

Personal Growth: You'll build organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills, making you an asset to any team

  • Basic office skills

  • Basic Business skills

  • Communication skills

  • Organizational skills

Hello everyone and welcome to the online-course created for any current or potential corporate managers from junior to executive level, that will make you stand out from the others.

I’m talking about digital transformation. In terms of customer communications in basically any meduim or big enterprises. And for small businesses, the most succesfull ones, they are already doing it in a modern way from the first day.

This transformation - it is a moving away from old way of communications, like phone calls, email, or even fax - to new way - whatsapp, facebook messenger, instagram direct messages, telegram - any messaging apps that people are using in their everyday life. And now they are starting to usу it to talk to businesses. To chat with an online store, with a bank, medical clinic - with any organization out there.

And here lies the opportunity!

All of these companies need employees or contractors who understand how to make this shift, this transition. New channels on the one hand bring a lot of new possibilities, such as chatbots and artificial intelligence, and on the other hand, require a rebuilding of current business workflows.

For example agent’s KPI in a contact centre based on whatsapp, is very different from a voice-based CC. And somebody need to know how to deal with it.

But the contact center is not the only place where apps like whatsapp are taking over. It affects pretty much every customer related departpent: sales, marketing and loyalty, support, customer experience, automation and online services.

So, Whether you plan to tie your career or business entirely to this feild, this knowledge will help you achieve your professional goals in a variety of ways. Because communication - is the essential part of business.

I started this journey seven years ago, when it was hardly even existed. Since then, I have worked with some of the world's biggest clients, such as Societe Generale, British american tobacco and others. Now I’m a founder of a startup called brandy. im

The second part is becoming more specific.

And with all of that we are getting ready to meet the main framework –

of ideal customer journey in modern channels. Which will be useful tool to any of your further projects.

courseDetails.title: JavaScript OOP: Mastering Modern Object-Oriented Programming
courseDetails.shortDescription: Mastering Object-Oriented JavaScript for Efficient and Error-Free Coding
courseDetails.longDescription:
In this comprehensive course on object-oriented programming (OOP) in modern JavaScript, you'll explore fundamental concepts and advanced techniques to enhance your mastery of JavaScript's OOP capabilities.


We begin by examining the basics, including object literals, square bracket usage, and property shorthand, alongside restrictions on property names and object iteration using `for...in` loops.


Advancing further, we delve into complex topics like object references, duplication, and reference-based comparison. You'll learn to modify constant objects, clone objects with nested structures, and grasp methods within objects, with a focus on the `this` keyword's significance.


Next, we introduce constructor functions and the `new` operator, clarifying constructor return values and demonstrating how to utilize optional chaining for error prevention and code optimization.


You'll also develop a profound understanding of symbol types, their global applications, and system symbol utilization. Additionally, we'll address object-to-primitive conversion strategies, including hints, and examine `toString` and `valueOf` methods for effective conversion management.


By course end, you'll possess a comprehensive grasp of modern JavaScript's OOP concepts, enabling you to write concise, efficient code and confidently tackle intricate programming challenges. This knowledge will not only elevate your JavaScript skills but also enhance your ability to design robust and scalable applications, making you a more versatile and valuable developer in today's competitive landscape.
